name: The Cliff Ao Nang Resort

reviews.text: After reading lots of reviews on hotels in krabi me and my husband settled on The Cliff for our 10 days in Ao Nang !! We had read that the location was abit misleading from the website but as it turned out the hotel is situated at the top end of the main road that runs straight down to the beach front. It's a 10 min walk or 40baht tuk tuk ride!! There's lots of shops, bars, restaurants on the way to keep you busy..... The Cliff resort is very beautiful, secluded and quiet , which to be honest was ideal as you can see that some of the hotels further down the road by the bars etc could be abit noisy at night!! (depending on what you want.....)
reviews.title: loved it !!!
I liked it!
reviews.text: The rooms are small and thank god we didnt take much luggage as there is only one wardrobe with 4 hangers and a draw underneath , no other storage !! There is a safe. loved the outdoor bathroom , Only had one scary moment when a frog decided to join me in the shower one morning , i think the whole resort knew about that.....!

The staff are brilliant , so helpfull and kind, always happy to answer our questions and give advice on what to do for days out. We booked 3 tours at the hotel as it was cheaper than the tour offices down the road and you could charge it to your room bill. We did elephant trekking (2hrs), Hong Island and phi phi tour both by speed boat ! great days out. For the 4 islands tour we hired a long tail boat for the day so we could please ourselves how long we wanted on each island and that was 1800 baht. (appx £26 for 6 hours ).
reviews.title: Nice valuable one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely small, friendly, stylish hotel. Only about 20 rooms and all are cabins set in woodland and rooms are styled with interesting touches, lots of glass and wood and a wonderful copper sink in the outdor bathroom. Lovely pool and lounging area with perfect views of cliffs. Bar/restaurant was open all day and served lovely food. Great breakfast. A little short on loungers and more children there than I expected so not as quiet as I hoped at the time I was there. Not keen on Ao Nang though it was no worse than I expected - too 'touristy' for me but some nice restaurants and the hotel is out of the centre which was good for me but still just a 5/10 min walk to the heart of the town. Really pretty hotel, great start to the holiday but if you prefer quiet places like me just do a couple of days there like I did.
reviews.title: Sublime small hotel

likes.liked: — the service at the hotel (especially the girls behind the front desk)
likes.disliked: — the mosquitoes & the rooms did not provide privacy

likes.liked: — choice of breakfast at room or restaurant

likes.liked: — Great Standard of rooms and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ~ good food especially breakfast that they deliver to your room (so that you can sit outside the room to eat)
reviews.title: Lovely! just go!

likes.liked: — the atmosphere once you have entered the building

reviews.title: cute boutique hotel
reviews.text: very nice litle hotel. when dining in the restaurant terrace with fulmoon I thought I was dining in my veranda alone with the stuff providing me anything before I even asked for it.
Very good prices in the restaurant with excelent quality.
reviews.title: A very pleasant place to spend a few nights.

reviews.text: The C iff was great. Upon arrival we had a tasty beverage and then were shown to our nice room. The rooms are indeed on the smaller side, but still adequate assuming you are not bringing too much baggage with you. It is not that far from the main strip (which is about 10 min maz walk or a 40 baht ride in a tuk-tuk) and franklly I am glad it is not on the strip. Nobody really goes to that beach anyway (the islands or Railay offer way better beaches), and it is nice to be up the hill away from all the noise). There is a cool bar with a pool table just down the street.
reviews.title: As good as we remembered!

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly, there is free internet, the pool is terrific, and frankly, I think the outdoor bathroom was one of the highlights. How often do you get a chance to stay someplace with a very nice, modern outdoor bath?
reviews.title: Shower with the geckoes!
Viva the Cliff
reviews.text: The staff can also book trips/tickets for you and it does not appear tht they mark anything up based on the ferry tickets they got us for Phi Phi. I would highly recommend chartering a longtail boat for an island excursion as the islands are really pretty and the beaches way better than Ao nang.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: CLIFF Resort What a lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed at this hotel in october'06 for 5 nights. It is deceiving from outside as u enter the hotel, because the entrance does not complement the hotel at all. But once u r in, that place i thought was different, very unique and friendliest hotel and u could almost say exclusive resort for honeymooners.
reviews.title: An absolute Oasis
Love it but something i can't belive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was as i described it above. Room is very tastefully decorated may be a bit small, could do with a table space, bathroom a unique situated outside, yes, outside the room. again very tastefully done. Food, breakfast excellent. It also has free internet which is very useful, not only because it is free but the convenience of it, and for laptop users it is also a wireless hot spot.
reviews.title: so romantic...

reviews.title: Most Enjoyable Stay!!!!

likes.liked: — The food, room and impeccable staff!
